oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Fort Loudoun, July 1954, FENCING. The entrance had been barricaded by cross-ties set in the ground. This barrier was removed and replaced by a strong oak gate. 1401 feet of new fencing was erected along the new (western) property boundary line.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The site had been run over by a herd of cattle.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Conservation & restoration; Fences; Forts & fortifications; Historic sites
